title: Decoder stopped with 'max_decoder_steps，synthesized wave file is unexpected long
body:
Hi erogol，

appreciate for your great effort to fix #471  issue on dev branch.
I have pulled the code, and happy to see it is still runing with so many epochs

meanwhile I got another issue, after 1405 steps, I tried to synthesize wav with certain sentence from training dataset.
it takes really long time, display the message "Decoder stopped with max_decoder_steps", the generated wav file is 58s  long while original wav is just about 2s.  

simply look into code:

it happened at tts/layers/tacotron2.py inference below, it seems inputs.shape[0] always equals to 1 
so the problem is caused by stop_token which seems predicted by stopnet.  please help, thanks a lot~

---------------------------------
#print(f"---- stop_tokens:{stop_tokens}\n t:{t} inputs.shape:{inputs.shape}\n")
            if stop_token > self.stop_threshold and t > inputs.shape[0] // 2:
                break
            if len(outputs) == self.max_decoder_steps:
                print("   | > Decoder stopped with 'max_decoder_steps")
                break

---------------------------------


test environment:
UBUNTU 1804, CPU 8 core, MEMORY 16GB, no GPU
test branch: dev
commit: e0f26d3
